alert.note: Alert for Lonoke; Prairie (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 25 at 6:49PM CDT until June 25 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN PRAIRIE...SOUTHEASTERN LONOKE...DESHA...MONROE... NORTHEASTERN DREW...CENTRAL JEFFERSON...CENTRAL LINCOLN AND ARKANSAS COUNTIES... At 648 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Roe to 7 miles southwest of Almyra to Richardson, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Stuttgart... Dumas... Rosedale... Clarendon... Rohwer... Altheimer... Gould... Gillett... Holly Grove... Humphrey... Grady... Arkansas City... Mitchellville... Almyra... St. Charles... Tillar... Watson... Ulm... Winchester... Roe... TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
